bullet-hell-js.title: Bullet Hell JS
bullet-hell-js.desc: A bullet hell shooter written in pure Javascript.
bullet-hell-js.long_desc: WASD to move, SPACE to shoot.  (Click inside the game to give it focus.)  A space shooter in the style of Space Invaders, created using Mainloop.js, HTML Canvas, and a whole lot of Javascript.

uncross-the-lines.title: Uncross the Lines
uncross-the-lines.desc: A math puzzle game about organizing a network of lines.
uncross-the-lines.long_desc: Click and drag the dots to move them around, and arrange them so that the lines don't cross.  Uniquely, this implementation allows for RTS-style box and shift selection: if you click and drag off of a dot, you'll draw a box that selects every dot it touches, and they can then be moved as a single unit.  You can also shift-click dots to add and remove them from your selection.

korean-number-practice.title: Korean Number Practice
korean-number-practice.desc: A webpage for practicing your Korean number skills.
korean-number-practice.long_desc: You will see two numbers written in Korean --- enter their sum in the box below.  If you're correct, you'll get a new problem automatically.  The internals of the project involve a lot of hacking with React state; I've learned from this project that React is not great for game development.

input-js.title: Input.js
input-js.desc: A simple Javascript library for handling mouse and keyboard input in a granular, user-agnostic way.
input-js.long_desc: Click inside the demo and hit SPACE to activate it.  Following the instructions will result in a variety of CSS tricks.  This project is a kind of library/utility for anyone who wants to handle mouse and keyboard input independent of any sophisticated frameworks, with a bent towards game development.

static-site-generator.title: Static Site Generator
static-site-generator.desc: A simple static site generator, good for rendering plain text with simple CSS backgrounds.
static-site-generator.long_desc: No demo here, but if you look at the source code, you'll see an engine that can hack a Webpack bundler to produce CSS pages loaded with the style and text of your choosing.  It's no rival to Wordpress or Wix, but it was a fun weekend project.
